title: LinkedIn Profile Visibility
subtitle: How keywords, headlines, and profile completeness affect recruiter search results

study_snapshot.what_it_studied: The relationship between LinkedIn profile optimization and visibility in recruiter searches, based on analysis of multiple industry studies and platform data.
study_snapshot.sample: Data aggregated from 10+ industry sources including JobScan, Forbes, ContentIn, and LinkedIn platform insights
study_snapshot.key_finding: Optimized LinkedIn profiles receive dramatically more visibility, with headline keywords being the single most important factor in recruiter search results.
study_snapshot.key_stat: Optimized profiles receive up to 14x more views
study_snapshot.so_what_for_linkedin: Your headline is not a job title—it's a search engine. Every word should be a keyword recruiters actually search for.

key_insights.title: Headlines Drive Search Visibility
key_insights.explanation: LinkedIn's algorithm places significant emphasis on keywords in your headline, often more than any other section. The headline is the most heavily weighted field for search ranking.
key_insights.riyp_implication: Our headline analysis identifies missing high-volume search terms and suggests specific rewrites that include keywords recruiters actually search for.

key_insights.title: 30-300% More Profile Views from Optimized Headlines
key_insights.explanation: Multiple studies show that optimizing your LinkedIn headline can increase profile views by 30% to 300%, depending on how generic the original headline was.
key_insights.riyp_implication: We flag generic headlines (e.g., 'Product Manager at Company') and provide specific rewrites with industry, metrics, and pedigree.

key_insights.title: 87% of Recruiters Use LinkedIn to Source Candidates
key_insights.explanation: LinkedIn is the primary sourcing platform for the vast majority of recruiters. Your profile is often the first impression before any resume is seen.
key_insights.riyp_implication: LinkedIn optimization is not optional for job seekers. An unoptimized profile means you're invisible to most recruiters.

key_insights.title: Profile Completeness Affects Ranking
key_insights.explanation: Fully completed profiles with job titles, descriptions, skills, and professional photos rank significantly higher in recruiter searches than incomplete profiles.
key_insights.riyp_implication: Our Completeness subscore identifies missing sections that hurt your search ranking.

key_insights.title: Profile Photos Lead to 21x More Views
key_insights.explanation: Profiles with professional photos receive up to 21 times more profile views than those without. This is one of the highest-impact, lowest-effort optimizations available.
key_insights.riyp_implication: We check photo status and flag missing or unprofessional photos as a top priority fix.

key_insights.title: Active Profiles Get Priority in Search
key_insights.explanation: LinkedIn's algorithm favors active users. Profiles with recent activity (posts, comments, profile updates) receive a ranking boost in recruiter searches.
key_insights.riyp_implication: Profile optimization is just the first step. Regular activity compounds the visibility gains.

limitations: LinkedIn does not publicly disclose its exact search algorithm, so some findings are inferred from observed behavior.
Statistics on profile view increases vary widely across sources (30% to 300%) depending on baseline optimization level.
Recruiter search behavior may vary by industry, geography, and role type.
Studies are primarily based on self-reported data and case studies, not controlled experiments.
